scenes.goal: Introduce recursion as a problem-solving technique
visual_elements: Simple diagram of a function calling itself
scenes.narrative_intent: Hook the audience by defining recursion and showing its self-referential nature.
Define the base case as the condition that stops recursion to prevent infinite loops.
Show how the function calls itself with a smaller input, moving toward the base case.
Illustrate how recursive calls build a call stack and unwind when the base case is reached.

visual_elements: Side-by-side: recursive tree vs. loop counter
Code snippets: recursive and iterative factorial
scenes.narrative_intent: Highlight similarities and differences, emphasizing trade-offs like readability vs. overhead.

visual_elements: Checklist: base case, progress toward base case, tail recursion note
scenes.narrative_intent: Warn about infinite recursion and stack overflow; give tips for safe recursion.
